module.title: toponyms
module.p: Toponyms are names identifying places and other geographical entities.
Like other kinds of name, toponyms can be classified into two distinct grammatical types –

ul.li: toponymic proper nouns eg. Barraigh Barra, Glaschu Glasgow, Alba Nuadh Nova Scotia, Sùilebheinn Suilven, Foirthe The Forth
toponymic name-descriptions eg. Am Ploc Plockton, Dùthaich MhicAoidh North Sutherland, Beinn a’ Bhreacaidh Ben Vrackie, An Linne Latharnach The Lorne Firth

module.p: Toponyms can also be classified semantically according to the kind of geographical entity they refer to –

ul.li: islands and districts eg. Barraigh, Dùthaich MhicAoidh
towns and settlements eg. Glaschu, Am Ploc
countries and continents eg. Aimearaga a Tuath North America, A’ Ghreug Greece
mountains and uplands eg. Sùilebheinn, Beinn a’ Bhreacaidh, Am Monadh Ruadh The Cairngorms
rivers, lakes and seas eg. An Linne Latharnach, Loch Obha Loch Awe, A’ Mhaoil The Minch
